meanings.definition: A Japanese battle cry or cheer.
meanings.sent1: During the war, the soldiers shouted banzais before charging into battle.
meanings.sent2: The crowd erupted in banzais as the team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully shouted banzais while pretending to be samurais.
meanings.sent4: The echoes of banzais filled the air, signaling the start of the festival.
meanings.sent5: The sound of banzais echoed through the valley, inspiring courage in all who heard.

meanings.sent1: She had a banzais reaction when she found out she won the contest.
meanings.sent2: The banzais fans cheered loudly at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The banzais crowd danced with joy at the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Her banzais energy was contagious, spreading to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The banzais atmosphere at the carnival made it a night to remember.
